#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Rescued
#Text=For a moment Ned and Mr. Damon gazed at the farmer in his rattletrap of an auto , and then they looked at the fluttering piece of paper in his hand .
#Text=Thence their gaze traveled to the ragged and barefoot lad sitting beside the farmer .
#Text=" I found it ! " announced the boy .
#Text=" Found what ? " asked Ned .
#Text=" That there note ! "
#Text=Without asking any more questions , reserving them until they knew more about the matter , Mr. Damon and Ned each reached out a hand for the paper the farmer held .
#Text=The latter handed it to Ned , being nearest him , and at a sight of the handwriting the young bank clerk exclaimed :
#Text=" It 's from Tom , all right ! "
#Text=" What happened to him ? " cried Mr. Damon .
#Text=" Where is he ?
#Text=" Wait , I 'll read it to you , " and he read :
#Text=" ' Whoever picks this up please send word at once to Mr. Swift or to Ned Newton in Shopton , or to Mr. Damon of Waterfield .

column3:
_	_	_	_

#Text= Bless my quinine pills ! " cried Mr Damon .

column1: #Text=" What in the world does it mean ?

column3:
_	_	_	_

#Text= That 's just what we 've got to find out , " decided Ned .

column1: #Text=" Where did you get this ? " he asked the farmer 's boy .
#Text=" Way off over there , " and he pointed across miles of fields .
#Text=" I was lookin ' for a lost cow , and I went past an old factory .

column3:
_	_	_	_

#Text= And what did you do , Sonny ? " asked Mr. Damon , as the boy paused .

column1: #Text=" Well , after a while I went to where the white thing lay , and I picked it up .

column3:
_	_	_	_

#Text= And did you go near the factory to find out who called or who threw the paper out ? " Ned queried .

column1: #Text=" I did n't , " the boy answered .
#Text=" I was scared .
#Text=" He come runnin ' in like a whitehead , and as soon as I saw the paper and heard what Bub had to say , I thought maybe I 'd better do somethin ' . "
#Text=" Did you go to the factory ? " asked Ned eagerly .
#Text=" No. I thought the best thing to do would be to find this Mr. Swift , or the other folks mentioned in this letter .

column3:
_	_	_	_

#Text= We 're two of the persons spoken of in that note , " said Mr. Damon , as he mentioned his name and introduced Ned .

column1: #Text=" We have been looking for our friend Tom Swift for two days now .

column3:
_	_	_	_

#Text= Where is this old factory you speak of , " continued Mr. Damon , " and how can we get there ?

_	_	_	_
43-17	2940-2943	and	_	_	_	_
43-18	2944-2947	how	_	_	_	_
43-19	2948-2951	can	_	_	_	_
43-20	2952-2954	we	person	giv	ana	57-1
43-21	2955-2958	get	_	_	_	_
43-22	2959-2964	there	_	_	_	_
43-23	2965-2966	?	_	_	_	_

#Text=It 's too bad one of you did n't go back , after finding the note , to tell Tom he was soon to be rescued .

_	_	_	_

#Text= Waal , maybe it is , " said the farmer , a bit put out by the criticism .

column1: #Text=" But I figgered it would be better to look up this young man 's friends and let them do the rescuin ' , and not lose no time , ' specially as it 's about as far from my place to the factory as it is to Shopton . "
#Text=" Well , I suppose that 's so , " agreed Ned .
#Text=" But what is this factory ? "
#Text=" It 's an old one where they started to make beet sugar , but it did n't pan out , " the farmer said .
#Text=" The place is in ruins , and I did hear , not long ago , that somebody run a threshin ' machine through it , an ' busted it up worse than before . "
#Text=" Great horned toads ! " cried Ned .
#Text=" That must be the very factory Tom ran his tank through .

column3:
_	_	_	_

#Text= Held by whom , do you suppose ? " asked Mr. Damon .

column1: #Text=" By that Blakeson gang , I imagine , " Ned answered .
#Text=" There 's no time to lose .
#Text=" We 're much obliged to you for bringing this note , " he went on to the farmer .
#Text=" And here is something to repay you for your trouble , " and he took out his wallet .
#Text=" Shucks !

column3:
_	_	_	_
61-2	4217-4223	Shucks	_	_	_	_
61-3	4224-4225	!	_	_	_	_

#Text=I did n't do this for pay !  objected the farmer .

_	_	_	_

62-13	4276-4277	.	_	_	_	_

#Text= It 's a pity I would n't help anybody what 's in trouble !

_	_	_	_

#Text= It turns out as well , perhaps , " agreed Ned .

column1: #Text=" We 'll look after Tom now . "
#Text=" And I 'll come along and help , " said the farmer .
#Text=" If there 's a gang of tramps in that factory , you may need some reinforcements .
